poem:
Title: "Fruit of Shadows"

In hollow halls of power, shadows grown,
Too thin the thread of truth to hold, too bare.
Where erstwhile forecasts, like fowl, have flown,
Only echoes of indifference linger there.
Details lost in throes of thoughtless act,
In numbers' dance, the heart's plea laid bare.
O, fickle ministers of fact,
Who trades the future for a Mare's Nest dare?
